page.title: 03Land Reclamation in Ryhill
page.content: Coal extraction at the Anglers Opencast site near Wintersett ceased in 1983 and NCB reclamation work began. Of the original 530 acres of the workings,395 will be returned to agricultural uses. The land will remain NCB responsibility for five years while its quality is improved. The remainder,a 70-acre lake and landscaped surrounds,will become a recreation area under local authority supervision with facilities for sailing,windsurfing,angling etc. The lake will have no natural water supply and will depend on pipeline connexion with the adjoining Wintersett reservoirs.The area will also remain NCB responsibility for five years while the effectiveness of the water supply is established.
